template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic software engineering task in {technical_domain} that includes defining requirements, building components, testing, fixing issues, and deploying to an environment; output only the prompt text under 45 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing a realistic software engineering task in backend microservices that includes defining requirements, building components, testing, fixing issues, and deploying to an environment; output only the prompt text under 45 words.

message.content: Design and implement a new microservice with a REST API for user notifications, write unit/integration tests, debug any failures, and deploy it to the staging environment.
message.reasoning_content:
Okay, the user wants a single-sentence prompt under 45 words describing a backend microservices task covering requirements, building, testing, fixing, and deploying. Let me break down each part they mentioned.

First, I need to include defining requirements, so maybe start with "Design and implement a new service." That sets the stage. Then, building componentsâ€”adding a REST API fits. Testing and fixing issues could be wrapped into "write unit/integration tests, debug failures." Deploying to an environment needs to be mentioned, so end with "and deploy it to the staging environment." 

Wait, check the word count: "Design and implement a new microservice with a REST API for user notifications, write unit/integration tests, debug any failures, and deploy it to the staging environment." That's 22 words, under the limit. It covers all the elements the user listed. 

Make sure it's realistic for a software engineering task. Yes, notifications are common, and the steps are typical for backend work. No need for extra details, just the plain-English prompt as requested.
